title: SQLong: Enhanced NL2SQL for Longer Contexts with LLMs
author: Dai Quoc Nguyen (Oracle Corporation), Cong Duy Vu Hoang (Oracle Corporation), Duy Vu (Oracle Corporation), Gioacchino Tangari (Oracle Corporation), Thanh Tien Vu (Oracle Corporation), Don Dharmasiri (Oracle Corporation), Yuan-Fang Li (Oracle Corporation), Long Duong (Oracle Corporation)
relevance_why: The paper introduces novel data augmentation techniques for handling large database schemas, which could inspire new approaches in audio/language processing tasks that require complex data manipulation.
background: The task involves translating natural language questions into Structured Query Language (SQL) queries, specifically in scenarios with large database schemas to improve usability and accuracy.
contribution: SQLong introduces a data augmentation framework to solve the limitations of existing models in processing long-context input for NL2SQL tasks, achieving significant performance improvements on benchmark datasets.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing models struggle with large schemas due to limited context handling and lack diverse augmented datasets.
technical_comparison.novelty: SQLong enhances model training by augmenting data through schema variety, allowing for effective management of larger contexts.

key_innovation: The method constructs long-context finetuning datasets by sampling and extending existing database schemas, thereby significantly improving LLM performance in NL2SQL tasks.
real_world_impact: This work has practical applications in developing more robust database query interfaces, potentially increasing accessibility for non-expert users interacting with complex databases.

new_terms.NL2SQL: **Natural Language to SQL** refers to the process of converting natural language queries into SQL code, enabling users to interact with databases using everyday language.
new_terms.data augmentation: **Data Augmentation** involves creating new training examples by modifying existing data in various ways, enhancing model robustness and performance.

open_sourcing: The data will be made publicly available upon paper acceptance.
